name: Amoud Foundation
mission: Founded in 1998, the Amoud Foundation impacts the local and global communities by helping people help themselves through sustainable humanitarian projects while maintaining trusting relationships. Amoud is an international humanitarian organization that today serves the people in the Horn of Africa. Amoud also does work on the home-front including helping with the 2006 Hurricane Relief and 2015 Garland Tornado recovery.
theoryOfChange: Amoud Foundation states it helps people help themselves through sustainable humanitarian projects while maintaining trusting relationships, and relieves suffering by establishing emergency relief and development programs.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.amoudfoundation.org/zakat (Source: https://www.amoudfoundation.org/zakat)

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.evidence: Niche cause: ADVOCACY (+4); Serves underserved populations (+3)
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 42/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, advocacy cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

judge_issues.message: The impact rationale mentions a high program expense ratio and cost-effective approach, but doesn't address the low financial health score (1/7) due to high working capital or the lack of verified evidence and outcomes (0/5). These factors significantly impacted the impact score and should be acknowledged in the rationale.

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: AMOUD FOUNDATION earns 80/100 due to strong alignment and strong impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.amoudfoundation.org/zakat (Source: https://www.amoudfoundation.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: Amoud Foundation holds a Charity Navigator score of 88.5/100 and supports orphan centers and schools.
The charity is Zakat-eligible and follows specific policies for asnaf categories.
The foundation provides various donation options for humanitarian programs.
The organization offers volunteer opportunities to engage with its mission.
In 2023, the foundation reported total revenue of $9,535,194 and a program expense ratio of 89.3%.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Amoud Foundation earns a high overall rating due to its excellent financial health, Zakat eligibility, and direct service model that minimizes overhead costs. Its high alignment score reflects a strong fit for donors seeking urgent humanitarian intervention.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing data transparency to improve medium data confidence levels
Expanding third-party impact verification for long-term educational outcomes

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization is highly aligned with Muslim donor priorities as a Zakat-eligible entity that adheres to specific asnaf categories [2]. Its focus on orphan care and advocacy for disabled students addresses urgent community needs with a proven track record of service [3][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates high financial efficiency with a program expense ratio of 89.3% and a Charity Navigator score of 88.5/100 [1][5]. Its direct service model provides food packages and healthcare with a cost-effective approach for each beneficiary served [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: Amoud Foundation provides critical humanitarian aid and educational support to vulnerable children and families across East Africa.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 89.3%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach beneficiaries
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity with 12.7 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: Amoud Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to uplifting communities through its 'Lift Up A Child' initiative, which supports 15 orphan centers and two specialized schools for the deaf and blind [1][5]. The organization maintains a strong commitment to Islamic giving principles, offering Zakat-eligible programs to address food insecurity and healthcare needs [2].

water projects, emergency food aid, and healthcare

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Amoud Foundation earns a high overall rating due to its excellent financial health, Zakat eligibility, and direct service model that minimizes overhead costs. Its high alignment score reflects a strong fit for donors seeking urgent humanitarian intervention.

areas_for_improvement.context: While overall performance is high, the foundation's <cite id="18">Accountability & Finance beacon score of 88</cite> suggests room for improvement in public transparency and formal documentation.
The foundation currently has <cite id="19">unverified evidence and outcomes</cite>, which could be strengthened by seeking external evaluations of their long-term educational programs.

bbb_assessment.summary: Meets 12 Standards for Charity Accountability according to external discovery data.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's long history and high program ratio mitigate concerns regarding the misuse of funds.
risk_factors: <cite id="18">Accountability score of 88/100</cite> indicates missing transparency best practices
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="19">lack of third-party impact evaluations</cite> and some transparency gaps in financial reporting.

confidence.notes: Strong financial data availability; impact data relies on internal reporting.

alignment.explanation: Amoud Foundation is a premier fit for Muslim donors, offering <cite id="9">Zakat-compliant programs</cite> that serve <cite id="10">underserved populations in Muslim-majority regions</cite>.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="1">28-year track record</cite> and its <cite id="20">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> from Candid. The board of <cite id="21">six members</cite> provides adequate oversight of its $9.5M budget.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity should address gaps in its <cite id="18">accountability score</cite> by publishing more detailed governance policies.

impact.explanation: The foundation achieves high impact through <cite id="22">direct service delivery</cite> with an exceptional <cite id="23">cost per beneficiary of $11.29</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="19">tracking outcomes for 3+ years</cite> to move beyond output-based reporting.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Theory of change documented but outcomes unverified

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct implementation of programs through foundation-managed centers

rich_narrative.headline: Amoud Foundation provides critical humanitarian aid and educational support to vulnerable children and families across East Africa.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to fulfill their Zakat obligations through a highly efficient, long-standing organization focused on direct humanitarian relief in Somalia.
donor_motivations: Want to support orphan care and specialized education for the disabled
Value organizations with deep local roots in East Africa
giving_considerations: Donations support direct service delivery rather than advocacy
Organization has strong liquidity, meaning gifts contribute to long-term stability
Impact is measured by outputs (beneficiaries served) rather than academic RCTs
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking rigorous, third-party verified impact data or those looking for domestic US-based advocacy.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects a clear theory of change and output tracking, but a lack of external evaluation or multi-year outcome data.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The foundation provides direct essential services (food, water, health) and specialized education to break the cycle of poverty for orphans and disabled children.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the $11.29 spent per beneficiary translates into long-term self-sufficiency.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Despite strong growth, the humanitarian needs in Somalia significantly exceed current funding levels.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Amoud Foundation's <cite id="7">89.3% program ratio</cite> is significantly higher than the <cite id="12">81.5% peer median</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Larger organization with broader global reach

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar size but focused on advocacy and civil rights

strengths.detail: The foundation directs <cite id="7">89.3% of its total expenses</cite> toward its core programs, significantly exceeding the <cite id="12">peer program ratio median of 81.5%</cite>.
Amoud Foundation demonstrates remarkable efficiency, spending <cite id="13">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite> according to baseline financial assessments.
The organization maintains <cite id="14">12.7 months of working capital</cite>, providing a substantial safety net for long-term project sustainability.

strengths_deep_dive: The Amoud Foundation's operational model is characterized by its lean administrative structure and direct service delivery. By maintaining <cite id="15">total assets of $8,810,970</cite> against relatively low liabilities, the organization has built a resilient financial base. Their leadership is recognized for strategic clarity, earning a <cite id="16">perfect 100/100 Leadership & Adaptability score</cite> from Charity Navigator. This stability allows them to manage complex logistics in Somalia, providing <cite id="8">essential healthcare and water infrastructure</cite> while keeping <cite id="17">officer compensation at a modest $114,998</cite> relative to the organization's $9.5M revenue scale.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1998</cite>, the Amoud Foundation is a dedicated humanitarian organization focused on uplifting vulnerable populations in East Africa, specifically within <cite id="2">Somaliland and Somalia</cite>. The foundation operates a diverse portfolio of relief efforts, including its signature 'Lift Up A Child' initiative which provides <cite id="3">assistance to 15 orphan centers</cite> and specialized support for <cite id="4">two schools for the deaf and blind</cite>. Financially, the organization demonstrates significant scale and growth, reporting <cite id="5">$9,535,194 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, representing a <cite id="6">3-year revenue CAGR of 18.6%</cite>. Amoud Foundation is highly efficient in its resource allocation, maintaining a <cite id="7">program expense ratio of 89.3%</cite>, ensuring that nearly all contributions directly fund field operations such as <cite id="8">water projects, emergency food aid, and healthcare</cite>. The organization is deeply rooted in Islamic philanthropic traditions, offering a <cite id="9">verified Zakat-eligible platform</cite> that directs funds to the <cite id="10">fuqara (poor) and masakin (needy)</cite> categories. With an <cite id="11">overall score of 88.88.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, the foundation balances strong leadership with a long-standing track record of service in one of the world's most underserved regions.
